fields.title: Pancakes
fields.variations: Mix up to 1/2 cup chocolate chips into the batter, or add three chocolate chips to each pancake while cooking. Add 25% more milk for thinnier, more crepe-like pancakes.
fields.directions:
1. Melt butter and let it cool.

2. In one bowl, mix dry ingredients (flour, salt, baking powder, chocolate chips).

2. In a second bowl, mix wet ingredients (egg, butter milk).

3. Mix wet into dry. 

4. In a frying pan on medium-low heat, cook a heaping tablespoon of batter for each pancake.

5. Serve with maple syrup.

fields.title: Sloppy Joes
fields.directions:
1. Add onion and pepper to skilled and heat over medium-high heat.

2. Before onion and pepper start to brown (after about 3 minutes), add beef and salt.

3. Cook, stirring to break up lumps, until beef is browned but not fully cooked.

4. Stir in tomato sauce and rest of ingredients (but no buns!)

5. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat and simmer gently for 5 minutes.

6. Pour over the buns. 

7. Eat with potato chips and pickles.

fields.title: Pork Tenderloin with Goat Cheese, Rosemary, & Honey
fields.directions:
1. Remove silver skin from pork tenderloin. 

2. Combine garlic powder, ground coriander, light brown sugar, salt, and pepper.

3. Rub the mixture all over the tenderloin.

4. Let sit for at least 30 minutes.

5. Preheat the oven to 400F. 

6. Drizzle with olive oil and cook in the oven for 45-50 minutes. 

7. Remove from oven and slice into serving-size pieces (accordion cut, not all the way through)

8. Fill the gaps between the meat with goat cheese and chopped rosemary. Drizzle with honey. 

9. Return to the oven for 2 minutes or until the goat cheese is melted.

fields.title: Chicken Tikka Masala
fields.directions:
THE DAY BEFORE
1. Make ginger-garlic paste (more than required; freeze the rest for next time) by pureeing 1/4 cup chopped unpeeled ginger, 3/4 cup garlic cloves, and 3/8 cup water.
2. Make chili paste (more than required; freeze the rest for next time) by pureeing 1/4 cup paprika, 1/4 cup chili powder, and 1/4 cup water.
3. Make marinade. Whisk together 1 cup yogurt, 1/4 cup chili paste, 1 Tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tsp garam masala, 1/4 tsp turmeric, 2 Tbsp lemon juice, 2 Tbsp mustard oil, 2 tsp salt.
4. Add 2 lbs of chopped-up chicken and refrigerate 4+ hours.


THE DAY OF
1. Cook chicken for 18-20 min at 425 degrees.
2. Puree 1 1/4 lbs tomatoes and finely chop 2 cups yellow onions.
3. In a large pot, heat 1 Tbsp canola oil and 6 Tbsp butter on medium-high ("until they shimmer").
4. Add 1/2 tsp cumin seeds.
5. Add 2 cups finely chopped onions and cook about 12 min (until dark brown).
6. Add 2 tsp ginger-garlic paste and cook 30 seconds.
7. Add pureed tomatoes and 1 tsp deggi mirch and cook 15 min, until tomato juice mostly evaporated.
8. Reduce heat to medium and add 1 Tbsp finely chopped ginger and 1/4 cup tomato paste, and cook 2 more minutes.
9. Add marinated chicken, 1 tsp salt, and 2 cups heavy cream, and simmer 5 more minutes. 
10. Serve with some cilantro on top.

fields.title: Grandma Betty's Mint Chocolate Chip Cookies
fields.directions:
1. Soak 1 1/2 cups chocolate chips overnight in a ziplock bag with 1 tsp peppermint extract.

2. Microwave 1 cup of these chips for 1 minute in 10-second intervals, until they are soft.

3. Combine 1 1/2 cups flour, 1 1/2 tsp baking powder, and 1/4 tsp salt in a small bowl.

4. Beat together 1 cup sugar, 6 Tbsp softened butter, and 1/2 tsp vanilla extract in a large bowl.

5. Add melted chocolate, 2 eggs, flour mixture, and remaining chips.

6. Make into balls and bake for 8-10 min at 350F.

fields.title: Apple Crumble
fields.directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350F.

2. Butter 8-by-8-inch baking dish.

3. In medium bowl, combine flour, 1/2 cup of brown sugar, oats, nuts, and salt.

4. Add the butter and stir with a fork until the crumbs are moist.

5. Add the apples to the buttered baking dish and toss with remaining 1/4 cup brown sugar, cinnamon, and lemon juice.

6. Spread the apples into an even layer.

7. Sprinkle the crumb mixture on top.

8. Bake until the apples are tender and the topping is crisp and brownish (about 50 to 60 minutes).

9. Serve plain or with whipped cream or ice cream.

fields.title: Whiskey Macks
fields.directions:
1. Line 2 cookie sheets with foil.

2. Put cocoa, corn syrup, whiskey, and butter in a medium saucepan. Sir over low heat until melted and well blended. Remove from heat.

3. Stir gingersnaps and walnuts into whiskey mixture; allow to cool slightly.

4. Roll pieces of mixture into walnut-sized balls, place on cookie sheet, and flatten with the heel of your hand.

5. Refrigerate 1 to 2 hours until firm.

6. Sprinkle powdered sugar lightly over the cookies.

7. Remove cookies delicately from the foil.

8. Store in an airtight container, preferably in the fridge.

fields.title: Pistachio Chicken Korma
fields.directions:
1. In a covered medium saucepan, combine 2 cups diced yellow onions with 1 cup water. Bring water to a boil and cook about 10 min, until onions are soft.

2. Puree the onions and cooking liquid.

3. In a bowl, mix the pureed onions with 1 cup yogurt.

4. Puree 1 cup pistachios, 1/2 cup chopped green bell pepper, 2 chopped Thai chilies, 1/2 cup chopped cilantro, and 1 cup water.

5. In a large saucepan, heat 2 Tbsp canola oil, stir in 1 Tsbp ginger-garlic paste (see CTM recipe), and cook for 30 seconds before adding the onion-yogurt mixture.

6. After that all comes to a boil (about 5 min), add the pistachio puree and 1/8 tsp turmeric and cook for 5 min.

7. Reduce heat to medium an add 2 Tbsp butter and 1/2 cup heavy cream.

8. Add 2 lbs chicken, 2 1/2 tsp salt, and 1 tsp ground cardamom and cook for about 15 minutes.

fields.title: Miss Lisa's Dressing
fields.directions:
1. Crush garlic.
2. Combine all ingredients together.

fields.title: Chocolate Chip Applesauce Bread/Cake
fields.directions:
1. In a big bowl, mix together 1 1/2 cups sugar with 1/2 cup butter
2. Mix in 2 eggs and 2 cups applesauce
3. Mix in 2 cups flour, 2 Tbsp cocoa, 1 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1 tsp vanilla
4. Mix in 1/2 cup chocolate chips
5. Pour into two buttered/floured pans
6. Bake at 350, checking with a knife at 25 min and every 5 min thereafter. You want the knife to come up with a little bit of goo on it but not a lot.

fields.title: Flavored Chocolate Chip Cookies of Unusual Texture
fields.description: Can be made mint, orange, whatever
fields.directions:
1. Combine 2 cups flour, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp baking soda in a small bowl.
2. In a large bowl, beat together 1 cup sugar and 1 stick (1/2 cup) butter.
3. Mix in 1/2 cup plain yogurt, 1 package vanilla pudding mix, and 1 egg.
4a. For green cookies: Add 1 tsp peppermint extract, 3 drops blue food coloring, and 15 drops green food coloring.
4b. For orange cookies: Instead, add 1 tsp orange extract, 3 drops red food coloring, and 15 drops yellow food coloring.
5. Add 1 1/2 cup chocolate chips.
6. Bake at 375F, checking first at 7 minutes. You want them to be just slightly brown on the bottom.

fields.title: Potato-and-Leek Soup
fields.directions:
1. Peel and cube 6 potatoes and 6 leeks.
2. Boil 8 cups of water and add 3 Tbsp of Better than Bullion to make 8 cups of stock.
3. Heat 4 Tbsp oil in a large pot, then add the cubed potatoes and leeks and some pepper and salt.
4. Cook on medium-high until it's all soft.
5. Add the stock and cook 20 minutes.
6. Stick it all in the blender and adjust the seasoning as needed.
7. Refrigerate; add some cream before serving.

fields.title: Hal's Pesto
fields.directions: 1. Blend together all ingredients (basil, salt, garlic, nuts, and olive oil)

fields.title: Green Soup
fields.directions:
1. Char 1 serrano chili, then steam it in a bowl, and then peel it.
2. Blend peeled chili with 2/3 cup peas, 4 cups corn, 3 large romaine lettuce leaves, 2 cups water, and a small handful of cilantro.
3. Chop 1 small/medium zucchini into small cubes and, in a pan, cook with 1 Tbsp olive oil until soft.
4. Blend the cooked zucchini.
5. Mince half of a small white onion and fry it with two minced garlic cloves and 3 Tbsp olive oil.
6. Blend the onion-garlic mixture.
7. Cook the zucchini and onion mixtures together in a big soup pot on high for 3 min.
8. Add the corn-pea mixture, cook for a while, and then add 2 cups water and 3 tsp salt.
9. Cook until done.

fields.title: Spicy Stir-fried Pork
fields.variations: Instead of pork belly, substitute steak such as a thin ribeye or flat iron. If using steak, you can fry the steak, then stir fry the rest of the ingredients in the same pan while the steak is cooling.
fields.directions:
1. In a large skillet on medium high, cook pork and onion for three minutes.

2. Make the sauce: In a medium bowl, mix soy sauce, gochujang, toasted sesame oil, sugar, gochugaru, black pepper, minced garlic, minced ginger, and minced green onion.

3. Lower heat to medium low and add the sauce. Cook for about 12 minutes, stirring often.

fields.title: Iced Holiday Cookies
fields.description: Simple and fun; get out your cookie cutters!
fields.introduction: This was Grandma Gwen Morgan's recipe.
fields.directions:
Preheat oven to 350F

1. Cream the butter well.

2. Slowly add the brown sugar and beat well.

3. Gradually add the flour and blend well.

4. Pat into two lumps that hold together, and then flatten the lumps slightly.

5. Put into two plastic bags or wrap each lump in plastic wrap.

6. Chill for about an hour.

7. Working with one flattish lump at a time (and keeping the lump you're not working with in the refrigerator, knead the dough slightly in your hands, and then roll out on a lightly floured board or countertop to about 1/8 inch thick. (Sometimes it's best to work in smallish quantities, tearing small chunks from the larger chunk to roll out.)

8. Cut into shapes and transfer them to a cookie sheet.

9. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until only slightly brown/golden. WATCH OUT!  They can burn fast!

10. Transfer the baked cookies to a cooling rack. (Be psychologically prepared for some breakage.)

11. Icing is in a separate recipe (honeybit.cooking/recipes/23)

fields.title: Icing for Holiday Cookies
fields.description: Can make a little or a lot
fields.prep_time: Depends on how much and how many colors
fields.directions:
1. Slice 2 Tbsp of butter into a medium  bowl.

2. Add, alternating, 1/2 cup sugar and 1 Tsp of milk, mixing with a hand mixer or wooden spoon until you've used an entire box of powder and the consistency is right for cookie icing.

3. If you'll be icing a lot of cookies, do the same thing with a second box of powdered sugar.

4. Divide the icing among a few small bowls and mix in the food coloring depending on how many and what colors you'll use.

5. Cookies are in a separate recipe (honeybit.cooking/recipes/22)

fields.title: Cast Iron Hibachi Steak
fields.directions:
1. Heat a cast iron skillet to high.

1. Season steak with salt and pepper, and sear for 60 seconds on each side.

1. While the steak is searing, make the sauce: Mix garlic, soy sauce, and oyster sauce. 

1. Add butter to skillet and cook the steak for one more minute on each side, basting each side with the butter.

1. Turn off the heat, and mix the sauce with the butter in the skillet.

1. Serve with rice and bang bang sauce.

fields.title: Bang Bang Sauce
fields.directions: 1. Mix all ingredients. Keep in refrigerator in an airtight container for up to a week.

fields.title: Butter-basted Steak
fields.directions:
1. Heat a cast iron skillet to high.

2. Season the steak with salt and pepper on both sides.

3. Sear the steak for one minute on each side.

4. Add half the butter to the skillet, and baste the steak for one minute, taking the skillet off the heat every 15 seconds so that the butter doesn't burn.

5. Flip the steak, and baste it with the remaining butter.

6. Let cool for about ten minutes.

fields.title: Spicy Carrot Soup
fields.description: Cat's creamy carrot soup for Fall
fields.directions:
1. Chop onion
2. Crush or mince garlic and ginger.
3. Sauté chopped onion in olive oil until translucent. Add garlic and ginger and sauté until fragrant (not toasty). 
4. Add a splash of sesame oil. 
5. Add in the broth, the baby carrots, the cayenne, and the salt/pepper. 
6. Bring to a boil, cover, and simmer for 15-20 (until carrots are tender)
7. Cool for 10 minutes
8. Pour into a blender and blend until smooth. (Or use an immersion blender)
9. Add in coconut milk and maple syrup. Taste. Add paprika and onion powder (for a more savory taste). Add any additional cayenne. 
10. Blend again
11. Pour into containers and serve/freeze.

fields.title: Mashed Potatoes
fields.directions:
1. Peel potatoes 
2. Boil in salted water until tender. Drain. 
3. Add cream cheese, butter, and milk. Beat with hand mixer until smooth.
4. Add salt and pepper.

fields.title: Gravy
fields.introduction: How to make gravy from roast chicken, turkey, or lamb
fields.directions:
Start preparing as the roasted beast is 10-15 minutes from coming out of the oven. Assemble on one side of the stove: gravy separator, saucepan, fork or whisk for stirring, one tablespoon for measuring flour and another for measuring grease/oil, wine, fruit juice, salt, pepper, gravy boat. Once you get going, you'll need to stand at the stove stirring and can't be looking around for ingredients.

1. Boil at least a cup of water in a teakettle or a microwave

2. Pour drippings (grease) from roasted chicken, turkey, or lamb into a gravy separator.

3. Add 1/2 cup boiling water into the pan in which the meat was cooked and stir with a fork to liquefy the flavorful stuff stuck there. 

4. Put 3 to 6 tablespoons of grease/oil into a saucepan and heat over medium heat.

5. When oil is heated, start adding flour, one heaping tablespoon at a time, stirring each time until well blended and all lumps are gone.

6. Keep adding spoonfuls of flour until you have a thickened roux, more solid than the liquid.

7. Add liquid (with no or very little grease) from the gravy separator and/or the water-added pan, about 1/2 cup at a time, stirring until fully absorbed and smooth each time.

8. Once all the liquid from the roasted beast has been added, start adding wine (red or white) and fruit juice (orange juice or apple cider) in alternating half-cup infusions, stirring until smooth. Shift balance toward wine or juice to taste.

9. When the liquid is soupy and no longer seems thickened, add salt pepper to taste. Add other herbs if you choose.

10. Stir over medium, then lower heat until gravy thickens -- 10 to 20 minutes. If it gets too thick, add more wine and/or juice.

fields.title: Macaroni and Cheese
fields.directions:
1. Arrange 3 or 4 pasta varieties on counter in order of cooking time.

2. Put large pot of water on to boil.

3. Grate the cheese

4. Chop the ham 

5. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.

6. When water is boiling, start adding the pasta, using math skills to time each variety perfectly. Keep  stirring occasionally.

7. Melt 3 to 4 oz butter in another pan (for efficiency, the one you will bake the mac and cheese in)

8. Add flour, a teaspoon at at time, stirring vigorously to blend and eliminate lumps. Stop when you have a thickened roux.

9. Add milk to the roux, 1/2 cup at a time, to make a white sauce. Stop when the sauce is the consistency of good (not store-bought) gravy.

10. Reserve 1 cup of the grated cheese and add the rest, with the chopped ham, to the white sauce. Add a few drops of Tabasco, some pepper, and a little salt. Stir over low to medium heat until the cheese melts.

11. Drain the pasta when done (a little firm is best).

12. Mix pasta and cheese sauce together in oven-worthy pan.

13. Top to mixed-up mac and cheese with the reserved cup of grated cheese.

14. Bake for about 40 minutes.

fields.title: Hummus
fields.description: with seared oyster mushrooms and pine nuts
fields.directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.

2. Make the tahini sauce: Nick off a quarter of the clove of garlic and drop it into the bowl of a food processor. Add lemon juice and tahini, making sure to scrape all the tahini out of the container. Season with a good pinch of salt and 1 teaspoon cumin. Process until mixture looks like peanut butter, about 1 minute. With motor running, stream in ice water, a little bit at a time, and continue processing until mixture is smooth and creamy.

3. Make the hummus: Add drained chickpeas to tahini sauce and continue to process until chickpeas are completely blended into tahini and hummus is smooth and uniform in color, about 3 minutes. While blending, pause motor occasionally to scrape down sides of bowl, then proceed. Set hummus aside.

4. Make the mushroom-pine nut topping.
4a. Toss pine nuts with a drizzle of canola oil and a pinch of kosher salt. Spread nuts across a small baking sheet and toast until golden brown, 5-7 minutes. Let pine nuts cool.
4b.Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Once pan is very hot, add 3 tablespoons canola oil. Stir in mushrooms and cook, undisturbed, until mushrooms start to caramelize, about 2 minutes. Season with a pinch of salt, a pinch of cumin, a pinch of turmeric and a small pinch of cinnamon. Once mushrooms have browned all over, after about 2 minutes more, turn off heat and add Sherry vinegar to pan. Toss to combine. Return pan to medium-high heat. Cook until liquid evaporates and mushrooms crisp, about 2 minutes more. Toss in toasted pine nuts and minced parsley.

5. To serve, smear hummus across 4 individual plates or a large platter, covering the base in a ½-inch layer of hummus. (Save any leftover hummus for another meal.) Top hummus with mushroom-pine nut topping and drizzle fresh olive oil overtop. Serve with warm pita or slices of brioche for scooping.

fields.title: Korean Potato Salad
fields.introduction: Source: https://kimchimari.com/korean-potato-salad/#wprm-recipe-container-14049. Will keep in fridge for 3-4 days.
fields.directions:
1. Make hard-boiled eggs - use your favorite method but I usually like to start cooking the egg in cold water on medium-high, bring to a boil, cover then turn heat off and leave for 10 minutes. When eggs are done, put them in ice water, peel them.

2. Roughly chop cooked eggs into small pieces. If you want to garnish the top with egg yolk, set aside 1 egg yolk and leave it uncut.

3. Peel potatoes and carrots. Cut potatoes into 3/4 inch thick discs then further into 1 inch or so squares. Cut carrots into 1/2 inch discs then cut the thicker parts into halves. Basically, you want the carrots to be about 1/2 the side of a potato.

4. Add potatoes to a pot and add enough water to fully cover it and then some. Add about 1/8 tsp salt. Bring to a boil and then boil on medium heat for 8-9 minutes then add the carrots. Cook about 8 minutes more until the potatoes kind of crumble when cutting with a fork and the carrots should be just softly cooked but not mush.

5. While potatoes are cooking, cut cucumbers into cubes.

6. Cut the apple into cubes. For color, you can just core them and cut with peels on. But if your apple is not organic or is waxed, peel it and then cut into cubes.

7. Drain potatoes and carrots. Set aside and let it cool.

8. In a large bowl, add potatoes, carrots, cucumbers and apples.

9. To the bowl, add mayonnaise and gently mix them all up. Then add chopped eggs. Mix again.

10. Add salt and sugar to taste. (About 3/8  to 1/2 tsp salt and  1/4 tsp sugar to my basic 2 potato salad).

11. Mix and taste again. By now, potatoes will most likely have disintegrated and become total mush as you see in the picture and that's how it should be. But it's also fine if it is still holding shape.

12. Optionally, using a sieve, grate the egg yolk on top of the potato salad.

13. Serve room temperature or cold from the fridge.

fields.title: Fancy Box Brownies
fields.description: with milk, butter, and coffee grounds
fields.directions:
Follow the box instructions, except: substitute milk for water, butter for oil; add vanilla extract, salt, espresso grounds, and chocolate chips.

1. Preheat oven to 325F.

2. Mix wet ingredients (milk, butter, egg, vanilla extract) in a bowl.

3. Add dry ingredients (brownie mix, espresso grounds, salt, walnuts, and chocolate chips). Stir until just blended.

4. Sprinkle sea salt on top.

5. Bake for 40 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.

fields.title: Extremely Easy Bang Bang Shrimp Tacos
fields.directions:
1. Pour olive oil into a pan. Turn heat to medium-high.

2. Place the frozen shrimp in the pan. Cook for 6 minutes, flipping halfway through.

3. While the shrimp is cooking, mix chili sauce, sriracha, and mayo. 

4. Dress broccoli slaw in the rice vinegar.

5. Once the shrimp are finished cooking, coat them in the sauce.

6. Assemble!

Optional: Heat up your tortilla(s) while shrimp is cooking.
